meanings.definition: Three times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: The treble amount of candies was enough to share with everyone.
meanings.sent2: She bought a treble number of balloons for the party.
meanings.sent3: The treble portion of cake made her smile from ear to ear.
meanings.sent4: His treble excitement was evident in his wide grin.
meanings.sent5: The treble quantity of stars in the sky was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The highest range of the human voice or of an instrument
meanings.sent1: Her beautiful singing voice reached a treble that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The violinist played a high treble note that resonated throughout the hall.
meanings.sent3: The bird's treble song in the morning brought joy to all who heard it.
meanings.sent4: The treble of the flute floated gently through the air.
meanings.sent5: The treble of the piano added a magical touch to the music.

meanings.sent1: They decided to treble their efforts to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to treble its production capacity by next year.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to treble the amount of chores for his siblings.
meanings.sent4: The news of the promotion made her heart treble with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The decision to treble the budget was met with mixed reactions.
